section.title: Introduction
section.para: In order to increase efficacy and richness of navigation, EPUB Publications include a "Navigation Center eXtended," the NCX. The NCX provides a means for the author to provide a multi-purpose declarative global navigation layer that is independent of the content it references.

The NCX was originally standardized by the DAISY Consortium, as defined in Section 8 of . The EPUB specification defines its own schema (XML grammar) for the NCX content type, as some multimedia and metadata components from the DAISY specification are not included.

section.title: Key NCX Components
section.para: The following are the key components of the NCX document:

listitem.para:
The exposes the hierarchical structure of the EPUB Publication. The provided structure is global, i.e. it transcends the boundaries of each individual in the
spine.
In terms of the number of links provided, the navMap is often more extensive than a traditional print table of contents.
A is a container for non-hierarchical navigational information that is secondary to the navMap.

Multiple navLists can be provided, either representing constructs with homogenous semantics (such as list of illustrations, or all quotes of a certain author in an anthology) or with heterogenous semantics (such as the ).

The is a special-purpose navList that allows representing the location of page boundaries present in a print source. Metadata for bibliographical identification of the print source can be defined via the element (and its children).

section.title: NCX Metadata
section.para: The NCX provides two mechanisms for expressing metadata:

listitem.para: The NCX element allows the expression of metadata concerning the NCX Document as a whole. This version of this specification does not require head metadata to be provided.

The epub:type attribute, as occurring on the , and elements, provides machine-readable metadata about the structural semantics of link target(s). Converserly, the element provides human-readable information.
Additionally, the element can be used to define metadata information (using the element) for the , and containers, as well as for the , and elements.

section.para: Mappings to metadata vocabularies used when expressing document and link target metadata are created using the and attributes on the root element . The EPUB Structural Semantics Vocabulary is the default metadata vocabulary of the NCX.

simplelist.member: An NCX Document must be a well-formed XML Document .
An NCX Document must be encoded in UTF-8 or UTF-16 .
An NCX Document must be valid to the NCX Document schema as defined in , and in addition must conform to all content conformance constraints expressed in .
The NCX Document filename should use the file extension .ncx. Any document fragments (included via XML entities or XInclude) should not use the .ncx extension.

EPUB Reading Systems must provide means to reach parts of a publication based on the information available within the NCX, by exposing the hierarchical navigation structure and the navigation lists specified by navMap, navList and pageList.

EPUB Reading Systems must use human-readable descriptions encoded within the navLabel element as authoritative information for rendering the hierarchical navigation structure and the navigation lists.

section.title: The pageTarget Element
section.para: The NCX pageTarget element specifies a pointer to content and briefly describes the target.

When a page break is present in the targeted (for example, an element with the epub:type="pagebreak" attribute), and when a page number is associated with this page break, then the text element in the navLabel of a pageTarget must contain the textual representation of the page number specified in the EPUB Content Document. Reading systems must use the text content of the navLabel as the authoritative rendering of the page number, and must enable direct navigation to the page break in the EPUB Content Document by using the text content of the navLabel. Note that there is no requirement for page numbers to be represented by numerical values, although of course this is a common authoring practice.
The order of the sequence of pageTarget elements must follow the order of the elements pointed to in the target EPUB Content Document, in the XML sense (depth-first traversal).

listitem.para: There are one or many pageTarget elements as last children of the element.
In this order: [optional], [required] (one or many), [required]

section.title: The landmarks navList
section.para: The landmarks navList identifies fundamental structural components of the publication, in order to enable Reading Systems to provide the user effective access to them.
The landmarks navList is identified through the landmarks value of the navList attribute. The landmarks navList is optional, and must not occur more than once within an NCX Document instance.

The structural semantics of each link target within this navList is determined through the value of the attribute on the descendants. The epub:type attribute is required on navTarget children of the landmarks navList.

section.title: The navLabel Element
section.para: The NCX navLabel element briefly describes the target in the . When applied to navPoints, it generally contains the heading text of the referenced section of the document.

There can be multiple navLabel elements, for example to provide information in various languages. Several navLabel elements with the same language (see xml:lang definition below) are forbidden. Since a navLabel element without the optional xml:lang attribute inherits the language specified for the top-level element, only one navLabel element without the xml:lang attribute is allowed. Reading systems should first attempt to find a navLabel matching the language specified by user preferences, secondly matching the language specified by the package's dc:language metadata element, thirdly matching the language specified by the xml:lang attribute on the element, and lastly by defaulting to the first available navLabel element (in XML document order).

listitem.para: The navLabel element is either optional or required depending on whether it describes the , , , , , element.
When this attribute isn't provided, the language of the navLabel element defaults to the xml:lang value inherited from the element.
When the dir attribute isn't provided, the text direction defaults to the dir value inherited from the element.
In this version of EPUB, the content model of the navLabel element is limited to text, as per the element. Future versions of EPUB may enable multimedia labels, using image and audio.
